com.poesys.accounting.dataloader.newaccounting

Class AccountingDbService

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.poesys.accounting.dataloader.newaccounting.AccountingDbService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDataAccessService

    public class AccountingDbService
extends java.lang.Object
implements IDataAccessService
    The production services for storing Accounting/DB data to the database given a set of "newaccounting" objects
    Author:
    Robert J. Muller

    • Method Detail

      • refreshAccountTypeCache

        private void refreshAccountTypeCache()
        Query the account types from the database to refresh the local cache of account types keyed on new-accounting account type (an enum).

      • storeCapitalStructure

        public void storeCapitalStructure(CapitalStructure structure)
        Description copied from interface: IDataAccessService

        Create and store Accounting/DB objects to the database for a capital structure with potentially multiple capital entities. The capital entities should not have nested account objects at this point.

        WARNING: run this method before running storeEntities(), as that method may persist capital accounts that require the capital entities be already present (due to a bug in Poesys/DB, the nested capital entity isn't automatically persisted before the account). .

        Specified by:
        storeCapitalStructure in interface IDataAccessService
        Parameters:
        structure - the capital structure object containing the capital entities

      • storeFiscalYears

        public void storeFiscalYears(java.util.List<FiscalYear> years)
        Description copied from interface: IDataAccessService

        Create and store Accounting/DB objects to the database for a list of fiscal years. The input fiscal year objects should not have any nested fiscal-year-account links at this point.

        WARNING: run this method before running storeEntity(), as that method may encounter problems with fiscal-year-account links and duplicate inserts.

        Specified by:
        storeFiscalYears in interface IDataAccessService
        Parameters:
        years - a list of years with no fiscal-year-account links

      • storeEntity

        public void storeEntity(java.lang.String entityName,
                        java.util.List<FiscalYear> years)
        Description copied from interface: IDataAccessService

        Create and store Accounting/DB objects to the database for an entity and a set of fiscal years for that entity. The fiscal years should have a set of fiscal-year-account links and the accounts linked, all of which get inserted during this call.

        WARNING: run this method before running storeTransactions(), as that method depends on having the fiscal years, entity, account groups, and accounts created.

        Specified by:
        storeEntity in interface IDataAccessService
        Parameters:
        entityName - the name of the accounting entity to store
        years - the list of fiscal years for the entity (order is important)

      • storeFiscalYearAccountLinks

        private void storeFiscalYearAccountLinks(java.util.List<com.poesys.accounting.bs.account.BsFiscalYearAccount> links)

      • getGroupByTypeAndName

                                                                              java.lang.String name)
        Get a persisted group business object by name from a type.

        Returns:
        the group with the specified name belonging to the type

      • getPersistedGroup

        private com.poesys.accounting.bs.account.BsAccountGroup getPersistedGroup(AccountGroup group)
        Get a persisted group object based on the new-accounting group object; this looks up the group in the local account-type cache using the account type associated with the specified group. The group must have at least one fiscal year account link. If there is no persisted group with the same name as the specified group, the method creates a new group and returns that; note that the group is not yet persisted. The method adds the group to the type in the type map cache.
        Parameters:
        group - the group to look up
        Returns:
        the persisted group corresponding to the specified group, or null if there is no persisted group

      • createAccount

        private com.poesys.accounting.bs.account.BsAccount createAccount(com.poesys.accounting.bs.account.BsEntity entity,
                                                                 Account account)
        Based on the presence of the capital entity in an input account, create the persistent account business object of the appropriate subclass belonging to a newly created entity business object and return it as a generic persistent account object. This is a Factory Method pattern.
        Parameters:
        entity - the newly created and not-yet-persisted entity business object
        account - the new-accounting-system account
        Returns:
        the generic, persistent account object

      • createCapitalEntityAccount

        private com.poesys.accounting.bs.account.BsAccount createCapitalEntityAccount(Account account,
                                                                              java.lang.String entityName,
                                                                              CapitalEntity capEntity)
        Create an account that associates with a capital entity. This can be a capital account or a distribution account. The method will create a persisted capital entity if one doesn't already exist. The method returns a superclass business object for the account.
        Parameters:
        account - the account to create
        entityName - the name of the entity that owns the account
        capEntity - the capital entity to associate with the account
        Returns:
        the generic account

      • getPersistedCapitalEntity

        private com.poesys.accounting.bs.account.BsCapitalEntity getPersistedCapitalEntity(CapitalEntity capEntity)
        Get a persisted capital entity business object (either existing or new) corresponding to a new-accounting capital entity.
        Parameters:
        capEntity - the capital entity
        Returns:
        the persisted capital entity business object

      • storeTransactions

        public void storeTransactions(java.util.Set<Transaction> transactions)
        Description copied from interface: IDataAccessService
        Create and store Accounting/DB transaction-related objects to the database for a set of transactions. This method assumes that entity, fiscal year, account group, and account data is already stored to the database. It also makes no assumptions about the transaction set. As this method represents a complete database transaction, the caller should submit a list of transactions that is complete with respect to the logical unit of work, usually transactions for all the existing fiscal years.
        Specified by:
        storeTransactions in interface IDataAccessService
        Parameters:
        transactions - the set of transactions to store

      • storeIds

        private void storeIds(java.util.Map<OldId,java.math.BigDecimal> ids)
        Store the map of transaction ids indexed by old transaction id.
        Parameters:
        ids - the map of old ids to new ids

      • linkReimbursements

        private void linkReimbursements(java.util.Set<Transaction> transactions,
                                com.poesys.accounting.bs.transaction.TransactionDelegate delegate)
        Link receivable items to reimbursing items based on the input transaction items. Use the shared AR items map to look up the database item objects.
        Parameters:
        transactions - set of transactions to link
        delegate - transaction delegate to use to create reimbursements

      • createTransactions

        private void createTransactions(java.util.Set<Transaction> transactions,
                                com.poesys.accounting.bs.transaction.TransactionDelegate delegate,
                                java.util.List<com.poesys.accounting.bs.transaction.BsTransaction> transactionList,
                                java.util.Map<OldId,java.math.BigDecimal> idMap)
        Create the transactions and items from the input set of transactions and put them into a list of database transactions. This also fills in a map of transaction ids indexed by old transaction id.
        Parameters:
        transactions - the input list of newaccounting transactions
        delegate - the transaction delegate to use to create objects
        transactionList - the output list of database transactions
        idMap - the map into which to put the id mappings

      • addIdsToMap

        private void addIdsToMap(java.util.Map<OldId,java.math.BigDecimal> ids,
                         java.lang.String entityName,
                         Transaction transaction,
                         com.poesys.accounting.bs.transaction.BsTransaction transactionObject)
        Add an old-id-to-new-id mapping to a map.
        Parameters:
        ids - the map to which to add the mapping
        entityName - the name of the entity owning the id
        transaction - the transaction with the old id
        transactionObject - the transaction with the new id
